metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9471 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The parse_datetime function in GNU coreutils allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted date string, as demonstrated by the "--date=TZ="123"345" @1" string to the touch or date command.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9471` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

coreutils - 8.21-1ubuntu5.1
mktemp - 8.21-1ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: coreutils package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.21-1ubuntu5.1').
